result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maya L Pate

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maya L Pate in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Maya L Pate.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is in court for a plea hearing. Defendant to plea to a new DPA. Parties need additional time to finish the DPA for defendant to plea to. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Maya L Pate.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.  At the request of the State, the State requests an adjournment due to lack of victim notification. Defense does not object. Court granted the States request. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022
Court was contacted by defense counsel regarding recent entry into DPA. Defense requested a new entry into DPA date due to reasons discussed. Plea hearing set for October 10th at 10:30 am.

Defendant Maya L Pate in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court for Maya L Pate.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY.
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Maya L Pate in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maya L Pate appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case heard off the record due to Court Reporter availability.
Defense counsel recently received the DPA and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Maya L Pate in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maya L Pate appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense informed the court that the State may be offering a DPA. Defendant to schedule TAD assessment.   Defense counsel has received discovery and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Maya L Pate in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Maya L Pate in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maya L Pate appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with EAB and LAC
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
